points.title: Your personal data is not sold
points.status: The privacy policy states, "EBSCO Information Services does not and will not sell Personal Information to third parties for a business or commercial purpose and has not sold Personal Information to third parties for a business or commercial purpose during the preceding 12 months or at any other time.  Likewise, we do not and will not sell Personal Information of minors under 16 years of age without affirmative authorization and have not sold Personal Information of minors under 16 years of age during the preceding 12 months or at any other time."

points.title: You can request access, correction and/or deletion of your data
points.status:
The privacy policy outlines methods for the user to access and edit the data collected by EBSCO which is outlined here, "If you would like to manage, change, limit, or delete your Personal Information, you can do so through your account settings on our Websites (if applicable) or by submitting a request using any of the methods provided below. To exercise any other legal rights with respect to your Personal Information, you may submit a request using any of the methods provided below."

It redirects the user to the necessary links to carry this out.

points.title: IP address and geolocation data is collected
points.status: The privacy policy states, "your IP address, geolocation, and certain device information [...] may be automatically captured when you access our Websites."

points.title: Your data is processed and stored in a country that is less friendly to user privacy protection
points.status:
The privacy policy states, "The Personal Information we collect from you may be transferred to, and processed in, countries other than the country in which you live. These countries may have data protection laws that are different than the laws of your country. Specifically, the servers we use to provide our Services are located in the United States. This means that when we collect your Personal Information, we may process it in the United States or the country where you live." 

For countries that differ in their approach to privacy protection, data sent to the United States may constitute as "a country that is less friendly to user privacy protection" as outlined in this case.

points.title: Your personal data is used for limited purposes
points.status: We use the Personal Information we collect for the limited purposes of processing your transactions, establishing and/or verifying a person’s or account holder’s identity, customer service, improving and customizing our Services and their content, authorization, content processing, content classification, and providing you with information concerning our Services.

points.title: Your personal data is used for limited purposes
points.status: We use the Personal Information we collect for the limited purposes of processing your transactions, establishing and/or verifying a person’s or account holder’s identity, customer service, improving and customizing our Services and their content, authorization, content processing, content classification, and providing you with information concerning our Services.

points.title: First-party cookies are used
points.status:
The cookie policy insinuates the use of first-party cookies by differentiating the use of cookies by EBSCO Information Services and third parties which can be found here "EBSCO Information Services and our third-party service providers may use cookies to collect information about your use of our Services"

Since EBSCO Information Services is part of the broader EBSCO service, it is implied that the cookies used are first-party.

points.title: Blocking first party cookies may limit your ability to use the service
points.status: The cookie policy states, "[Strictly Necessary Cookies] are essential, as they enable you to move around and use the features of our Websites, such as accessing logged in or secure areas. We also use these cookies to authenticate users and help identify and prevent security risks. Because these cookies are essential, they cannot be disabled."

points.title: You are being tracked via social media cookies/pixels
points.status: The cookie policy states, "Our Websites may use social media features, such as the Facebook ‘like’ button (“Social Media Features”) [to] collect your IP address and which page you are visiting on our Websites, and may set a cookie to enable the feature to function properly. "

points.title: Third-party cookies are used for advertising
points.status:
In EBSCO's cookie policy, it states,"EBSCO Information Services and our third-party service providers may use cookies to collect information about your use of our Websites... We may also use cookies from third parties for marketing purposes (such as interest-based online advertising)." This confirms the use of third party cookies and its purpose of advertising to the user. 

This is further supported by a detailed summary of the site's use of Performance Cookies seen here: "[Performance cookies] are used to deliver advertising that is relevant to your interests...This information may be shared with organizations outside of EBSCO Information Services’, such as advertisers and/or advertising networks." This clearly states that cookies are used for advertising and may be shared to third parties.

points.title: The cookies used by this service do not contain information that would personally identify you
points.status: The cookie policy states, "We also use [performance cookies] to track aggregate usage of our Websites in an anonymized fashion and experiment with new features and changes to the Websites." No where else in this policy does it state that personal information is collected or stored.

points.title: This service tracks you on other websites
points.status: Under the subsection "How do we use cookies?" EBSCO's cookie policy states, "These cookies can remember that your device has accessed our Websites and may also be able to track your device’s browsing activity on websites or services other than ours. This information may be shared with organizations outside of EBSCO Information Services’, such as advertisers and/or advertising networks."

points.title: A list of all cookies set by the website is provided
points.status:
Under the subsection "What cookies do we use?" EBSCO's cookie policy states, 
"We use the following four general categories of cookies:

    Strictly Necessary
    Performance
    Functionality
    Targeting"

In the following subsection, it details the function of each cookie category and how it is used.

points.title: There is a date of the last update of the terms
This service ignores the Do Not Track (DNT) header and tracks users anyway even if they set this header.
points.quoteText: EBSCO Information Services does not recognize automated browser signals regarding tracking mechanisms, which may include ‘do not track’ instructions.

points.title: This service ignores the Do Not Track (DNT) header and tracks users anyway even if they set this header.
points.quoteText: Do Not Track Signals: EBSCO Information Services does not recognize automated browser signals regarding tracking mechanisms, which may include ‘do not track’ instructions.

points.title: This service ignores the Do Not Track (DNT) header and tracks users anyway even if they set this header.
points.quoteText: Do Not Track Signals: EBSCO Information Services does not recognize automated browser signals regarding tracking mechanisms, which may include ‘do not track’ instructions.

points.title: Users should revisit the terms periodically, although in case of material changes, the service will notify
points.quoteText:
If we make any material changes, we will notify you by means of a notice on our Websites (such as a banner or pop-up) prior to the changes becoming effective and provide you with the ability to consent to these changes (such as an "I agree" or "OK" button, or a prominent statement indicating the changes are in effect and continued use of the Websites signifies consent).
 We encourage you to periodically review this page for the latest information on our privacy practices.
